cyclone.name: IDALIA
cyclone.current_location: about 65 mi (105 km) NE of Cozumel, Mexico

motion.direction: Stationary (expected to begin drifting north Monday)

cyclone.trajectory: Forecast to move slowly north into the east-central Gulf of Mexico, turn northeast, make landfall along Florida’s Big Bend Wednesday, then accelerate NE across GA/SC and off the Southeast coast Thursday
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: Florida Big Bend coast (near Apalachee Bay/Cedar Key area)

weather_observation.watch_coast: Tulum to Rio Lagartos (Yucatan) and extreme western Cuba
weather_observation.warning_coast: Yucatan Peninsula from Tulum to Rio Lagartos, including Cozumel
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Eastern Gulf Coast and the Southeast U.S. shoreline from Florida Big Bend through the Georgia and South Carolina coasts
weather_observation.storm_surge_above_3_feet: Possible (2–4 ft coastal inundation cannot be ruled out at high tide)
weather_observation.wind: 10–20% chance of sustained tropical-storm-force winds; occasional gusts 35–45 mph late Wed night–Thu
weather_observation.storm_surge: Minor to moderate surge of 2–4 ft possible in Charleston Harbor and adjacent barrier-island beaches Thursday
weather_observation.rainfall: Heavy bands could produce 3–6 in of rain with localized higher totals, leading to flash flooding in low-lying port areas
weather_observation.other_hazards: Elevated seas and swells, dangerous rip currents, and isolated tornadoes in outer rainbands could disrupt cargo handling and vessel traffic
